properties.description: • vpc_connector - (Optional) The VPC Network Connector that this cloud function can connect to. It can be either the fully-qualified URI, or the short name of the network connector resource. The format of this field is projects/*/locations/*/connectors/*.

properties.name: source_archive_bucket
properties.description: • source_archive_bucket - (Optional) The GCS bucket containing the zip archive which contains the function.

properties.name: source_archive_object
properties.description: • source_archive_object - (Optional) The source archive object (file) in archive bucket.

properties.name: source_repository
properties.description: • source_repository - (Optional) Represents parameters related to source repository where a function is hosted. Cannot be set alongside source_archive_bucket or source_archive_object. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: max_instances
properties.description: • max_instances - (Optional) The limit on the maximum number of function instances that may coexist at a given time.
The event_trigger block supports:

properties.name: event_type
properties.description: • event_type - (Required) The type of event to observe. For example: "google.storage.object.finalize". See the documentation on calling Cloud Functions for a full reference. Cloud Storage, Cloud Pub/Sub and Cloud Firestore triggers are supported at this time. Legacy triggers are supported, such as "providers/cloud.storage/eventTypes/object.change", "providers/cloud.pubsub/eventTypes/topic.publish" and "providers/cloud.firestore/eventTypes/document.create".

properties.name: resource
properties.description: • resource - (Required) Required. The name or partial URI of the resource from which to observe events. For example, "myBucket" or "projects/my-project/topics/my-topic"

properties.name: failure_policy
properties.description: • failure_policy - (Optional) Specifies policy for failed executions. Structure is documented below.
The failure_policy block supports:

properties.name: retry
properties.description: (Required) Whether the function should be retried on failure. Defaults to false.
The source_repository block supports:

properties.name: list description
properties.description: url - (Required) The URL pointing to the hosted repository where the function is defined. There are supported Cloud Source Repository URLs in the following formats:

properties.name: https://source.developers.google.com/projects/*/repos/*/revisions/*/paths/*
properties.description: • To refer to a specific commit: https://source.developers.google.com/projects/*/repos/*/revisions/*/paths/*

properties.name: https://source.developers.google.com/projects/*/repos/*/moveable-aliases/*/paths/*
properties.description: • To refer to a moveable alias (branch): https://source.developers.google.com/projects/*/repos/*/moveable-aliases/*/paths/*. To refer to HEAD, use the master moveable alias.

properties.name: https://source.developers.google.com/projects/*/repos/*/fixed-aliases/*/paths/*
properties.description: • To refer to a specific fixed alias (tag): https://source.developers.google.com/projects/*/repos/*/fixed-aliases/*/paths/*
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_function
properties.description: (Required) Used to find the parent resource to bind the IAM policy to

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) The location of this cloud function. Used to find the parent resource to bind the IAM policy to

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the project will be parsed from the identifier of the parent resource. If no project is provided in the parent identifier and no project is specified, the provider project is used.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member/members - (Required) Identities that will be granted the privilege in role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• allUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is on the internet; with or without a Google account.
• allAuthenticatedUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is authenticated with a Google account or a service account.
• user:{emailid}: An email address that represents a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one google_cloudfunctions_function_iam_binding can be used per role. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required only by google_cloudfunctions_function_iam_policy) The policy data generated by a google_iam_policy data source.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name for the resource, required by device registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The Region in which the created address should reside. If it is not provided, the provider region is used.

properties.name: event_notification_config
properties.description: • event_notification_config - (Deprecated) Use event_notification_configs instead.

properties.name: event_notification_configs
properties.description: • event_notification_configs - (Optional) List of configurations for event notification, such as PubSub topics to publish device events to. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: state_notification_config
properties.description: • state_notification_config - (Optional) A PubSub topic to publish device state updates. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: mqtt_config
properties.description: • mqtt_config - (Optional) Activate or deactivate MQTT. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: http_config
properties.description: • http_config - (Optional) Activate or deactivate HTTP. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: credentials
properties.description: • credentials - (Optional) List of public key certificates to authenticate devices. Structure is documented below.
The event_notification_configs block supports:

properties.name: pubsub_topic_name
properties.description: • pubsub_topic_name - (Required) PubSub topic name to publish device events.

properties.name: subfolder_matches
properties.description: • subfolder_matches - (Optional) If the subfolder name matches this string exactly, this configuration will be used. The string must not include the leading '/' character. If empty, all strings are matched. Empty value can only be used for the last event_notification_configs item.
The state_notification_config block supports:

properties.name: pubsub_topic_name
properties.description: (Required) PubSub topic name to publish device state updates.
The mqtt_config block supports:

properties.name: mqtt_enabled_state
properties.description: (Required) The field allows MQTT_ENABLED or MQTT_DISABLED.
The http_config block supports:

properties.name: http_enabled_state
properties.description: (Required) The field allows HTTP_ENABLED or HTTP_DISABLED.
The credentials block supports:

properties.name: public_key_certificate
properties.description: (Required) The certificate format and data.
The public_key_certificate block supports:

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Required) The field allows only X509_CERTIFICATE_PEM.

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: (Required) The certificate data.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: billing_account_id
properties.description: • billing_account_id - (Required) The billing account id.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied.

properties.name: members
properties.description: • members - (Required) A list of users that the role should apply to. For more details on format and restrictions see https://cloud.google.com/billing/reference/rest/v1/Policy#Binding
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: billing_account_id
properties.description: • billing_account_id - (Required) The billing account id.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied.

properties.name: member
properties.description: • member - (Required) The user that the role should apply to. For more details on format and restrictions see https://cloud.google.com/billing/reference/rest/v1/Policy#Binding
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: billing_account_id
properties.description: • billing_account_id - (Required) The billing account id.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required) The google_iam_policy data source that represents the IAM policy that will be applied to the billing account. This policy overrides any existing policy applied to the billing account.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The folder’s display name. A folder’s display name must be unique amongst its siblings, e.g. no two folders with the same parent can share the same display name. The display name must start and end with a letter or digit, may contain letters, digits, spaces, hyphens and underscores and can be no longer than 30 characters.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: • parent - (Required) The resource name of the parent Folder or Organization. Must be of the form folders/{folder_id} or organizations/{org_id}.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder
properties.description: • folder - (Required) The resource name of the folder the policy is attached to. Its format is folders/{folder_id}.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: members (Required) - An array of identities that will be granted the privilege in the role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• user:{emailid}: An email address that is associated with a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.
• For more details on format and restrictions see https://cloud.google.com/billing/reference/rest/v1/Policy#Binding

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one google_folder_iam_binding can be used per role. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder
properties.description: • folder - (Required) The resource name of the folder the policy is attached to. Its format is folders/{folder_id}.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member - (Required) The identity that will be granted the privilege in the role. For more details on format and restrictions see https://cloud.google.com/billing/reference/rest/v1/Policy#Binding This field can have one of the following values:
• user:{emailid}: An email address that represents a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder
properties.description: • folder - (Required) The resource name of the folder the policy is attached to. Its format is folders/{folder_id}.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required) The google_iam_policy data source that represents the IAM policy that will be applied to the folder. This policy overrides any existing policy applied to the folder.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder
properties.description: • folder - (Required) The resource name of the folder to set the policy for. Its format is folders/{folder_id}.

properties.name: constraint
properties.description: • constraint - (Required) The name of the Constraint the Policy is configuring, for example, serviceuser.services. Check out the complete list of available constraints.
<hr/>

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Optional) Version of the Policy. Default version is 0.

properties.name: boolean_policy
properties.description: • boolean_policy - (Optional) A boolean policy is a constraint that is either enforced or not. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: list_policy
properties.description: • list_policy - (Optional) A policy that can define specific values that are allowed or denied for the given constraint. It can also be used to allow or deny all values. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: restore_policy
properties.description: • restore_policy - (Optional) A restore policy is a constraint to restore the default policy. Structure is documented below.

Note: If none of [boolean_policy, list_policy, restore_policy] are defined the policy for a given constraint will effectively be unset. This is represented in the UI as the constraint being 'Inherited'.
<hr/>
The boolean_policy block supports:

properties.name: enforced
properties.description: (Required) If true, then the Policy is enforced. If false, then any configuration is acceptable.
The list_policy block supports:

properties.name: allow
properties.description: • allow or deny - (Optional) One or the other must be set.

properties.name: suggested_values
properties.description: • suggested_values - (Optional) The Google Cloud Console will try to default to a configuration that matches the value specified in this field.

properties.name: inherit_from_parent
properties.description: • inherit_from_parent - (Optional) If set to true, the values from the effective Policy of the parent resource are inherited, meaning the values set in this Policy are added to the values inherited up the hierarchy.
The allow or deny blocks support:

properties.name: all
properties.description: • all - (Optional) The policy allows or denies all values.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) The policy can define specific values that are allowed or denied.
The restore_policy block supports:

properties.name: default
properties.description: (Required) May only be set to true. If set, then the default Policy is restored.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org_id
properties.description: • org_id - (Required) The numeric ID of the organization to set the policy for.
