• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one google_dataproc_job_iam_binding can be used per role. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.
google_dataproc_job_iam_policy only: * policy_data - (Required) The policy data generated by a google_iam_policy data source.
<hr/>

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The project in which the job belongs. If it is not provided, Terraform will use the provider default.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which the job belongs. If it is not provided, Terraform will use the provider default.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: dns_name
properties.description: • dns_name - (Required) The DNS name of this managed zone, for instance "example.com.".

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) User assigned name for this resource. Must be unique within the project.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A textual description field. Defaults to 'Managed by Terraform'.

properties.name: dnssec_config
properties.description: • dnssec_config - (Optional) DNSSEC configuration Structure is documented below.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to this ManagedZone.

properties.name: visibility
properties.description: • visibility - (Optional) The zone's visibility: public zones are exposed to the Internet, while private zones are visible only to Virtual Private Cloud resources. Must be one of: public, private.

properties.name: private_visibility_config
properties.description: • private_visibility_config - (Optional) For privately visible zones, the set of Virtual Private Cloud resources that the zone is visible from. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: forwarding_config
properties.description: • forwarding_config - (Optional, Beta) The presence for this field indicates that outbound forwarding is enabled for this zone. The value of this field contains the set of destinations to forward to. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: peering_config
properties.description: • peering_config - (Optional, Beta) The presence of this field indicates that DNS Peering is enabled for this zone. The value of this field contains the network to peer with. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The dnssec_config block supports:

properties.name: kind
properties.description: • kind - (Optional) Identifies what kind of resource this is

properties.name: non_existence
properties.description: • non_existence - (Optional) Specifies the mechanism used to provide authenticated denial-of-existence responses.

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - (Optional) Specifies whether DNSSEC is enabled, and what mode it is in

properties.name: default_key_specs
properties.description: • default_key_specs - (Optional) Specifies parameters that will be used for generating initial DnsKeys for this ManagedZone. If you provide a spec for keySigning or zoneSigning, you must also provide one for the other. Structure is documented below.
The default_key_specs block supports:

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: • algorithm - (Optional) String mnemonic specifying the DNSSEC algorithm of this key

properties.name: key_length
properties.description: • key_length - (Optional) Length of the keys in bits

properties.name: key_type
properties.description: • key_type - (Optional) Specifies whether this is a key signing key (KSK) or a zone signing key (ZSK). Key signing keys have the Secure Entry Point flag set and, when active, will only be used to sign resource record sets of type DNSKEY. Zone signing keys do not have the Secure Entry Point flag set and will be used to sign all other types of resource record sets.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: • kind - (Optional) Identifies what kind of resource this is
The private_visibility_config block supports:

properties.name: networks
properties.description: - (Optional) The list of VPC networks that can see this zone. Until the provider updates to use the Terraform 0.12 SDK in a future release, you may experience issues with this resource while updating. If you've defined a networks block and add another networks block while keeping the old block, Terraform will see an incorrect diff and apply an incorrect update to the resource. If you encounter this issue, remove all networks blocks in an update and then apply another update adding all of them back simultaneously. Structure is documented below.
The networks block supports:

properties.name: network_url
properties.description: - (Optional) The fully qualified URL of the VPC network to bind to. This should be formatted like https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/{project}/global/networks/{network}
The forwarding_config block supports:

properties.name: target_name_servers
properties.description: - (Optional) List of target name servers to forward to. Cloud DNS will select the best available name server if more than one target is given. Structure is documented below.
The target_name_servers block supports:

properties.name: ipv4_address
properties.description: - (Optional) IPv4 address of a target name server.
The peering_config block supports:

properties.name: target_network
properties.description: - (Optional) The network with which to peer. Structure is documented below.
The target_network block supports:

properties.name: network_url
properties.description: - (Optional) The fully qualified URL of the VPC network to forward queries to. This should be formatted like https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/{project}/global/networks/{network}
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: - (Required) User assigned name for this policy.
<hr/>

properties.name: alternative_name_server_config
properties.description: • alternative_name_server_config - (Optional) Sets an alternative name server for the associated networks. When specified, all DNS queries are forwarded to a name server that you choose. Names such as .internal are not available when an alternative name server is specified. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A textual description field. Defaults to 'Managed by Terraform'.

properties.name: enable_inbound_forwarding
properties.description: • enable_inbound_forwarding - (Optional) Allows networks bound to this policy to receive DNS queries sent by VMs or applications over VPN connections. When enabled, a virtual IP address will be allocated from each of the sub-networks that are bound to this policy.

properties.name: enable_logging
properties.description: • enable_logging - (Optional) Controls whether logging is enabled for the networks bound to this policy. Defaults to no logging if not set.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: • networks - (Optional) List of network names specifying networks to which this policy is applied. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The alternative_name_server_config block supports:

properties.name: target_name_servers
properties.description: - (Optional) Sets an alternative name server for the associated networks. When specified, all DNS queries are forwarded to a name server that you choose. Names such as .internal are not available when an alternative name server is specified. Structure is documented below.
The target_name_servers block supports:

properties.name: ipv4_address
properties.description: - (Optional) IPv4 address to forward to.
The networks block supports:

properties.name: network_url
properties.description: - (Optional) The fully qualified URL of the VPC network to bind to. This should be formatted like https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/{project}/global/networks/{network}

properties.name: timeouts
properties.description: » Timeouts
This resource provides the following Timeouts configuration options:

properties.name: create
properties.description: Default is 4 minutes.

properties.name: update
properties.description: Default is 4 minutes.

properties.name: delete
properties.description: Default is 4 minutes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: managed_zone
properties.description: • managed_zone - (Required) The name of the zone in which this record set will reside.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The DNS name this record set will apply to.

properties.name: rrdatas
properties.description: • rrdatas - (Required) The string data for the records in this record set whose meaning depends on the DNS type. For TXT record, if the string data contains spaces, add surrounding \" if you don't want your string to get split on spaces. To specify a single record value longer than 255 characters such as a TXT record for DKIM, add \"\" inside the Terraform configuration string (e.g. "first255characters\"\"morecharacters").

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Required) The time-to-live of this record set (seconds).

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The DNS record set type.
<hr/>

properties.name: project
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: : (Required) The name of the service. Usually of the form $apiname.endpoints.$projectid.cloud.goog.
<hr/>

properties.name: openapi_config
properties.description: • openapi_config: (Optional) The full text of the OpenAPI YAML configuration as described here. Either this, or both of grpc_config and protoc_output_base64 must be specified.

properties.name: grpc_config
properties.description: • grpc_config: (Optional) The full text of the Service Config YAML file (Example located here). If provided, must also provide protoc_output_base64. open_api config must not be provided.

properties.name: protoc_output_base64
properties.description: • protoc_output_base64: (Optional) The full contents of the Service Descriptor File generated by protoc. This should be a compiled .pb file, base64-encoded.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project: (Optional) The project ID that the service belongs to. If not provided, provider project is used.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: • networks - (Required) VPC networks to which the instance is connected. For this version, only a single network is supported. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Required) The name of the Filestore zone of the instance.
The file_shares block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the fileshare (16 characters or less)

properties.name: capacity_gb
properties.description: • capacity_gb - (Required) File share capacity in GiB. This must be at least 1024 GiB for the standard tier, or 2560 GiB for the premium tier.
The networks block supports:

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Required) The name of the GCE VPC network to which the instance is connected.

properties.name: modes
properties.description: • modes - (Required) IP versions for which the instance has IP addresses assigned.

properties.name: reserved_ip_range
properties.description: • reserved_ip_range - (Optional) A /29 CIDR block that identifies the range of IP addresses reserved for this instance.

properties.name: ip_addresses
properties.description: • ip_addresses - A list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the instance.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Resource labels to represent user-provided metadata.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: collection
properties.description: • collection - (Required) The collection being indexed.

properties.name: fields
properties.description: • fields - (Required) The fields supported by this index. The last field entry is always for the field path __name__. If, on creation, __name__ was not specified as the last field, it will be added automatically with the same direction as that of the last field defined. If the final field in a composite index is not directional, the __name__ will be ordered "ASCENDING" (unless explicitly specified otherwise). Structure is documented below.
The fields block supports:

properties.name: field_path
properties.description: • field_path - (Optional) Name of the field.

properties.name: order
properties.description: • order - (Optional) Indicates that this field supports ordering by the specified order or comparing using =, <, <=, >, >=. Only one of order and arrayConfig can be specified.

properties.name: array_config
properties.description: • array_config - (Optional) Indicates that this field supports operations on arrayValues. Only one of order and arrayConfig can be specified.
<hr/>

properties.name: database
properties.description: • database - (Optional) The Firestore database id. Defaults to "(default)".

properties.name: query_scope
properties.description: • query_scope - (Optional) The scope at which a query is run. One of "COLLECTION" or "COLLECTION_GROUP". Defaults to "COLLECTION".

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.

properties.description: • name - (Required) The resource name for the Dataset.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location for the Dataset.

properties.name: time_zone
properties.description: • time_zone - (Optional) The default timezone used by this dataset. Must be a either a valid IANA time zone name such as "America/New_York" or empty, which defaults to UTC. This is used for parsing times in resources (e.g., HL7 messages) where no explicit timezone is specified.

properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.

type: IAM policy for Google Cloud Healthcare dataset

properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: dataset_id
properties.description: • dataset_id - (Required) The dataset ID, in the form {project_id}/{location_name}/{dataset_name} or {location_name}/{dataset_name}. In the second form, the provider's project setting will be used as a fallback.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member/members - (Required) Identities that will be granted the privilege in role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• allUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is on the internet; with or without a Google account.
• allAuthenticatedUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is authenticated with a Google account or a service account.
• user:{emailid}: An email address that represents a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one google_healthcare_dataset_iam_binding can be used per role. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required only by google_healthcare_dataset_iam_policy) The policy data generated by a google_iam_policy data source.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The resource name for the FhirStore. ** Changing this property may recreate the FHIR store (removing all data) **

properties.name: dataset
properties.description: • dataset - (Required) Identifies the dataset addressed by this request. Must be in the format 'projects/{project}/locations/{location}/datasets/{dataset}'
<hr/>

properties.name: enable_update_create
properties.description: • enable_update_create - (Optional) Whether this FHIR store has the updateCreate capability. This determines if the client can use an Update operation to create a new resource with a client-specified ID. If false, all IDs are server-assigned through the Create operation and attempts to Update a non-existent resource will return errors. Please treat the audit logs with appropriate levels of care if client-specified resource IDs contain sensitive data such as patient identifiers, those IDs will be part of the FHIR resource path recorded in Cloud audit logs and Cloud Pub/Sub notifications.

properties.name: disable_referential_integrity
properties.description: • disable_referential_integrity - (Optional) Whether to disable referential integrity in this FHIR store. This field is immutable after FHIR store creation. The default value is false, meaning that the API will enforce referential integrity and fail the requests that will result in inconsistent state in the FHIR store. When this field is set to true, the API will skip referential integrity check. Consequently, operations that rely on references, such as Patient.get$everything, will not return all the results if broken references exist. ** Changing this property may recreate the FHIR store (removing all data) **

properties.name: disable_resource_versioning
properties.description: • disable_resource_versioning - (Optional) Whether to disable resource versioning for this FHIR store. This field can not be changed after the creation of FHIR store. If set to false, which is the default behavior, all write operations will cause historical versions to be recorded automatically. The historical versions can be fetched through the history APIs, but cannot be updated. If set to true, no historical versions will be kept. The server will send back errors for attempts to read the historical versions. ** Changing this property may recreate the FHIR store (removing all data) **

properties.name: enable_history_import
properties.description: • enable_history_import - (Optional) Whether to allow the bulk import API to accept history bundles and directly insert historical resource versions into the FHIR store. Importing resource histories creates resource interactions that appear to have occurred in the past, which clients may not want to allow. If set to false, history bundles within an import will fail with an error. ** Changing this property may recreate the FHIR store (removing all data) ** ** This property can be changed manually in the Google Cloud Healthcare admin console without recreating the FHIR store **

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) User-supplied key-value pairs used to organize FHIR stores. Label keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long, have a UTF-8 encoding of maximum 128 bytes, and must conform to the following PCRE regular expression: [\p{Ll}\p{Lo}][\p{Ll}\p{Lo}\p{N}-]{0,62} Label values are optional, must be between 1 and 63 characters long, have a UTF-8 encoding of maximum 128 bytes, and must conform to the following PCRE regular expression: [\p{Ll}\p{Lo}\p{N}-]{0,63} No more than 64 labels can be associated with a given store. An object containing a list of "key": value pairs. Example: { "name": "wrench", "mass": "1.3kg", "count": "3" }.

properties.name: notification_config
properties.description: • notification_config - (Optional) A nested object resource Structure is documented below.
The notification_config block supports:

properties.name: pubsub_topic
properties.description: - (Required) The Cloud Pub/Sub topic that notifications of changes are published on. Supplied by the client. PubsubMessage.Data will contain the resource name. PubsubMessage.MessageId is the ID of this message. It is guaranteed to be unique within the topic. PubsubMessage.PublishTime is the time at which the message was published. Notifications are only sent if the topic is non-empty. Topic names must be scoped to a project. cloud-healthcare@system.gserviceaccount.com must have publisher permissions on the given Cloud Pub/Sub topic. Not having adequate permissions will cause the calls that send notifications to fail.

properties.name: pubsub_topic
properties.description: - (Required) The Cloud Pub/Sub topic that notifications of changes are published on. Supplied by the client. PubsubMessage.Data will contain the resource name. PubsubMessage.MessageId is the ID of this message. It is guaranteed to be unique within the topic. PubsubMessage.PublishTime is the time at which the message was published. Notifications are only sent if the topic is non-empty. Topic names must be scoped to a project. cloud-healthcare@system.gserviceaccount.com must have publisher permissions on the given Cloud Pub/Sub topic. Not having adequate permissions will cause the calls that send notifications to fail.

type: IAM policy for Google Cloud Healthcare HL7v2 store

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member/members - (Required) Identities that will be granted the privilege in role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• allUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is on the internet; with or without a Google account.
• allAuthenticatedUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is authenticated with a Google account or a service account.
• user:{emailid}: An email address that represents a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one google_healthcare_hl7_v2_store_iam_binding can be used per role. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.

properties.description: • name - (Required) The resource name for the CryptoKey.

properties.name: key_ring
properties.description: • key_ring - (Required) The KeyRing that this key belongs to. Format: 'projects/{{project}}/locations/{{location}}/keyRings/{{keyRing}}'.
<hr/>

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Labels with user-defined metadata to apply to this resource.

properties.name: purpose
properties.description: • purpose - (Optional) The immutable purpose of this CryptoKey. See the purpose reference for possible inputs.

properties.name: rotation_period
properties.description: • rotation_period - (Optional) Every time this period passes, generate a new CryptoKeyVersion and set it as the primary. The first rotation will take place after the specified period. The rotation period has the format of a decimal number with up to 9 fractional digits, followed by the letter s (seconds). It must be greater than a day (ie, 86400).

properties.name: version_template

properties.name: protection_level

properties.name: timeouts
properties.description: » Timeouts
This resource provides the following Timeouts configuration options:

properties.name: create
properties.description: Default is 4 minutes.

properties.name: delete
properties.description: Default is 4 minutes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the subscription.

properties.name: topic
properties.description: • topic - (Required) A reference to a Topic resource.
<hr/>

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to this Subscription.

properties.name: push_config
properties.description: • push_config - (Optional) If push delivery is used with this subscription, this field is used to configure it. An empty pushConfig signifies that the subscriber will pull and ack messages using API methods. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: ack_deadline_seconds
properties.description: • ack_deadline_seconds - (Optional) This value is the maximum time after a subscriber receives a message before the subscriber should acknowledge the message. After message delivery but before the ack deadline expires and before the message is acknowledged, it is an outstanding message and will not be delivered again during that time (on a best-effort basis). For pull subscriptions, this value is used as the initial value for the ack deadline. To override this value for a given message, call subscriptions.modifyAckDeadline with the corresponding ackId if using pull. The minimum custom deadline you can specify is 10 seconds. The maximum custom deadline you can specify is 600 seconds (10 minutes). If this parameter is 0, a default value of 10 seconds is used. For push delivery, this value is also used to set the request timeout for the call to the push endpoint. If the subscriber never acknowledges the message, the Pub/Sub system will eventually redeliver the message.

properties.name: message_retention_duration
properties.description: • message_retention_duration - (Optional) How long to retain unacknowledged messages in the subscription's backlog, from the moment a message is published. If retainAckedMessages is true, then this also configures the retention of acknowledged messages, and thus configures how far back in time a subscriptions.seek can be done. Defaults to 7 days. Cannot be more than 7 days ("604800s") or less than 10 minutes ("600s"). A duration in seconds with up to nine fractional digits, terminated by 's'. Example: "600.5s".

properties.name: retain_acked_messages
properties.description: • retain_acked_messages - (Optional) Indicates whether to retain acknowledged messages. If true, then messages are not expunged from the subscription's backlog, even if they are acknowledged, until they fall out of the messageRetentionDuration window.

properties.name: expiration_policy
properties.description: • expiration_policy - (Optional) A policy that specifies the conditions for this subscription's expiration. A subscription is considered active as long as any connected subscriber is successfully consuming messages from the subscription or is issuing operations on the subscription. If expirationPolicy is not set, a default policy with ttl of 31 days will be used. The minimum allowed value for expirationPolicy.ttl is 1 day. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The push_config block supports:

properties.name: push_endpoint
properties.description: • push_endpoint - (Required) A URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed. For example, a Webhook endpoint might use "https://example.com/push".

properties.name: list description
properties.description: attributes - (Optional) Endpoint configuration attributes. Every endpoint has a set of API supported attributes that can be used to control different aspects of the message delivery. The currently supported attribute is x-goog-version, which you can use to change the format of the pushed message. This attribute indicates the version of the data expected by the endpoint. This controls the shape of the pushed message (i.e., its fields and metadata). The endpoint version is based on the version of the Pub/Sub API. If not present during the subscriptions.create call, it will default to the version of the API used to make such call. If not present during a subscriptions.modifyPushConfig call, its value will not be changed. subscriptions.get calls will always return a valid version, even if the subscription was created without this attribute. The possible values for this attribute are:

properties.name: v1beta1: uses the push format defined in the v1beta1 Pub/Sub API.
properties.description: • v1beta1: uses the push format defined in the v1beta1 Pub/Sub API.

properties.name: v1 or v1beta2: uses the push format defined in the v1 Pub/Sub API.
properties.description: • v1 or v1beta2: uses the push format defined in the v1 Pub/Sub API.
The expiration_policy block supports:

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: - (Optional) Specifies the "time-to-live" duration for an associated resource. The resource expires if it is not active for a period of ttl. The definition of "activity" depends on the type of the associated resource. The minimum and maximum allowed values for ttl depend on the type of the associated resource, as well. If ttl is not set, the associated resource never expires. A duration in seconds with up to nine fractional digits, terminated by 's'. Example - "3.5s".
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: subscription
properties.description: • subscription - (Required) The subscription name or id to bind to attach IAM policy to.

• allUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is on the internet; with or without a Google account.
• allAuthenticatedUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is authenticated with a Google account or a service account.
• user:{emailid}: An email address that represents a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

Your project's PubSub service account (service-{{PROJECT_NUMBER}}@gcp-sa-pubsub.iam.gserviceaccount.com) must have roles/cloudkms.cryptoKeyEncrypterDecrypter to use this feature. The expected format is projects/*/locations/*/keyRings/*/cryptoKeys/*

The message_storage_policy block supports:

properties.description: - (Required) A list of IDs of GCP regions where messages that are published to the topic may be persisted in storage. Messages published by publishers running in non-allowed GCP regions (or running outside of GCP altogether) will be routed for storage in one of the allowed regions. An empty list means that no regions are allowed, and is not a valid configuration.

properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the project will be parsed from the identifier of the parent resource. If no project is provided in the parent identifier and no project is specified, the provider project is used.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member/members - (Required) Identities that will be granted the privilege in role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• allUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is on the internet; with or without a Google account.
• allAuthenticatedUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is authenticated with a Google account or a service account.
• user:{emailid}: An email address that represents a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one google_pubsub_topic_iam_binding can be used per role. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required only by google_pubsub_topic_iam_policy) The policy data generated by a google_iam_policy data source.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The ID of the instance or a fully qualified identifier for the instance.

properties.name: memory_size_gb
properties.description: • memory_size_gb - (Required) Redis memory size in GiB.
<hr/>

properties.name: alternative_location_id
properties.description: • alternative_location_id - (Optional) Only applicable to STANDARD_HA tier which protects the instance against zonal failures by provisioning it across two zones. If provided, it must be a different zone from the one provided in [locationId].

properties.name: authorized_network
properties.description: • authorized_network - (Optional) The full name of the Google Compute Engine network to which the instance is connected. If left unspecified, the default network will be used.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Optional) An arbitrary and optional user-provided name for the instance.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Resource labels to represent user provided metadata.

properties.name: redis_configs
properties.description: • redis_configs - (Optional) Redis configuration parameters, according to http://redis.io/topics/config. Please check Memorystore documentation for the list of supported parameters: https://cloud.google.com/memorystore/docs/redis/reference/rest/v1/projects.locations.instances#Instance.FIELDS.redis_configs

properties.name: location_id
properties.description: • location_id - (Optional) The zone where the instance will be provisioned. If not provided, the service will choose a zone for the instance. For STANDARD_HA tier, instances will be created across two zones for protection against zonal failures. If [alternativeLocationId] is also provided, it must be different from [locationId].

properties.name: list description
properties.description: redis_version - (Optional) The version of Redis software. If not provided, latest supported version will be used. Currently, the supported values are:

properties.name: REDIS_4_0 for Redis 4.0 compatibility
properties.description: • REDIS_4_0 for Redis 4.0 compatibility

properties.name: REDIS_3_2 for Redis 3.2 compatibility
properties.description: • REDIS_3_2 for Redis 3.2 compatibility

properties.name: reserved_ip_range
properties.description: • reserved_ip_range - (Optional) The CIDR range of internal addresses that are reserved for this instance. If not provided, the service will choose an unused /29 block, for example, 10.0.0.0/29 or 192.168.0.0/29. Ranges must be unique and non-overlapping with existing subnets in an authorized network.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: tier - (Optional) The service tier of the instance. Must be one of these values:

properties.name: BASIC: standalone instance
properties.description: • BASIC: standalone instance

properties.name: STANDARD_HA: highly available primary/replica instances
properties.description: • STANDARD_HA: highly available primary/replica instances

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The name of the Redis region of the instance.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the runtime config.
<hr/>

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description to associate with the runtime config.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the variable to manage. Note that variable names can be hierarchical using slashes (e.g. "prod-variables/hostname").

properties.name: parent
properties.description: • parent - (Required) The name of the RuntimeConfig resource containing this variable.

properties.name: text
properties.description: • text or value - (Required) The content to associate with the variable. Exactly one of text or variable must be specified. If text is specified, it must be a valid UTF-8 string and less than 4096 bytes in length. If value is specified, it must be base64 encoded and less than 4096 bytes in length.
<hr/>

properties.name: project
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The source’s display name. A source’s display name must be unique amongst its siblings, for example, two sources with the same parent can't share the same display name. The display name must start and end with a letter or digit, may contain letters, digits, spaces, hyphens, and underscores, and can be no longer than 32 characters.

properties.name: organization
properties.description: • organization - (Required) The organization whose Cloud Security Command Center the Source lives in.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: - (Optional) The description of the source (max of 1024 characters).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Required) Name of VPC network connected with service producers using VPC peering.

properties.name: service
properties.description: • service - (Required) Provider peering service that is managing peering connectivity for a service provider organization. For Google services that support this functionality it is 'servicenetworking.googleapis.com'.

properties.name: reserved_peering_ranges
properties.description: • reserved_peering_ranges - (Required) Named IP address range(s) of PEERING type reserved for this service provider. Note that invoking this method with a different range when connection is already established will not reallocate already provisioned service producer subnetworks.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: - (Required) Resource name of the repository, of the form {{repo}}. The repo name may contain slashes. eg, name/with/slash
<hr/>

properties.name: project
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: repository
properties.description: • repository - (Required) Used to find the parent resource to bind the IAM policy to

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the project will be parsed from the identifier of the parent resource. If no project is provided in the parent identifier and no project is specified, the provider project is used.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member/members - (Required) Identities that will be granted the privilege in role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• allUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is on the internet; with or without a Google account.
• allAuthenticatedUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is authenticated with a Google account or a service account.
• user:{emailid}: An email address that represents a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one google_sourcerepo_repository_iam_binding can be used per role. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required only by google_sourcerepo_repository_iam_policy) The policy data generated by a google_iam_policy data source.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique identifier for the database, which cannot be changed after the instance is created. Values are of the form [a-z][-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9].

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) The instance to create the database on.
<hr/>

properties.name: ddl
properties.description: • ddl - (Optional) An optional list of DDL statements to run inside the newly created database. Statements can create tables, indexes, etc. These statements execute atomically with the creation of the database: if there is an error in any statement, the database is not created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: database
properties.description: • database - (Required) The name of the Spanner database.

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) The name of the Spanner instance the database belongs to.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member/members - (Required) Identities that will be granted the privilege in role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• allUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is on the internet; with or without a Google account.
• allAuthenticatedUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is authenticated with a Google account or a service account.
• user:{emailid}: An email address that represents a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one google_spanner_database_iam_binding can be used per role. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required only by google_spanner_database_iam_policy) The policy data generated by a google_iam_policy data source.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: - (Required) A unique identifier for the instance, which cannot be changed after the instance is created. The name must be between 6 and 30 characters in length.
If not provided, a random string starting with tf- will be selected.

properties.name: config
properties.description: • config - (Required) The name of the instance's configuration (similar but not quite the same as a region) which defines defines the geographic placement and replication of your databases in this instance. It determines where your data is stored. Values are typically of the form regional-europe-west1 , us-central etc. In order to obtain a valid list please consult the Configuration section of the docs.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The descriptive name for this instance as it appears in UIs. Must be unique per project and between 4 and 30 characters in length.
<hr/>

properties.name: num_nodes
properties.description: • num_nodes - (Optional) The number of nodes allocated to this instance.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) An object containing a list of "key": value pairs. Example: { "name": "wrench", "mass": "1.3kg", "count": "3" }.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) The name of the instance.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member/members - (Required) Identities that will be granted the privilege in role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• allUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is on the internet; with or without a Google account.
• allAuthenticatedUsers: A special identifier that represents anyone who is authenticated with a Google account or a service account.
• user:{emailid}: An email address that represents a specific Google account. For example, alice@gmail.com or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{emailid}: An email address that represents a service account. For example, my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.
• group:{emailid}: An email address that represents a Google group. For example, admins@example.com.
• domain:{domain}: A G Suite domain (primary, instead of alias) name that represents all the users of that domain. For example, google.com or example.com.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one google_spanner_instance_iam_binding can be used per role. Note that custom roles must be of the format [projects|organizations]/{parent-name}/roles/{role-name}.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required only by google_spanner_instance_iam_policy) The policy data generated by a google_iam_policy data source.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the database in the Cloud SQL instance. This does not include the project ID or instance name.

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) The name of the Cloud SQL instance. This does not include the project ID.
<hr/>

properties.name: charset
properties.description: • charset - (Optional) The charset value. See MySQL's Supported Character Sets and Collations and Postgres' Character Set Support for more details and supported values. Postgres databases only support a value of UTF8 at creation time.

properties.name: collation
properties.description: • collation - (Optional) The collation value. See MySQL's Supported Character Sets and Collations and Postgres' Collation Support for more details and supported values. Postgres databases only support a value of en_US.UTF8 at creation time.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.

properties.name: timeouts
properties.description: » Timeouts
This resource provides the following Timeouts configuration options:

properties.name: create
properties.description: Default is 15 minutes.

properties.name: update
properties.description: Default is 10 minutes.

properties.name: delete
properties.description: Default is 10 minutes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) The region the instance will sit in. Note, first-generation Cloud SQL instance regions do not line up with the Google Compute Engine (GCE) regions, and Cloud SQL is not available in all regions - choose from one of the options listed here. A valid region must be provided to use this resource. If a region is not provided in the resource definition, the provider region will be used instead, but this will be an apply-time error for all first-generation instances and for second-generation instances if the provider region is not supported with Cloud SQL. If you choose not to provide the region argument for this resource, make sure you understand this.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: • settings - (Required) The settings to use for the database. The configuration is detailed below.
<hr/>

properties.name: database_version
properties.description: • database_version - (Optional, Default: MYSQL_5_6) The MySQL or PostgreSQL version to use. Can be MYSQL_5_6, MYSQL_5_7, POSTGRES_9_6 or POSTGRES_11 (beta) for second-generation instances, or MYSQL_5_5 or MYSQL_5_6 for first-generation instances. See Second Generation Capabilities for more information.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional, Computed) The name of the instance. If the name is left blank, Terraform will randomly generate one when the instance is first created. This is done because after a name is used, it cannot be reused for up to one week.

properties.name: master_instance_name
properties.description: • master_instance_name - (Optional) The name of the instance that will act as the master in the replication setup. Note, this requires the master to have binary_log_enabled set, as well as existing backups.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.

properties.name: replica_configuration
properties.description: • replica_configuration - (Optional) The configuration for replication. The configuration is detailed below.
The required settings block supports:

properties.name: tier
properties.description: • tier - (Required) The machine tier (First Generation) or type (Second Generation) to use. See tiers for more details and supported versions. Postgres supports only shared-core machine types such as db-f1-micro, and custom machine types such as db-custom-2-13312. See the Custom Machine Type Documentation to learn about specifying custom machine types.

properties.name: activation_policy
properties.description: • activation_policy - (Optional) This specifies when the instance should be active. Can be either ALWAYS, NEVER or ON_DEMAND.

properties.name: authorized_gae_applications
properties.description: • authorized_gae_applications - (Optional) A list of Google App Engine (GAE) project names that are allowed to access this instance.

properties.name: availability_type
properties.description: • availability_type - (Optional) This specifies whether a PostgreSQL instance should be set up for high availability (REGIONAL) or single zone (ZONAL).

properties.name: crash_safe_replication
properties.description: • crash_safe_replication - (Optional) Specific to read instances, indicates when crash-safe replication flags are enabled.

properties.name: disk_autoresize
properties.description: • disk_autoresize - (Optional, Second Generation, Default: true) Configuration to increase storage size automatically. Note that future terraform apply calls will attempt to resize the disk to the value specified in disk_size - if this is set, do not set disk_size.

properties.name: disk_size
properties.description: • disk_size - (Optional, Second Generation, Default: 10) The size of data disk, in GB. Size of a running instance cannot be reduced but can be increased.

properties.name: disk_type
properties.description: • disk_type - (Optional, Second Generation, Default: PD_SSD) The type of data disk: PD_SSD or PD_HDD.

properties.name: pricing_plan
properties.description: • pricing_plan - (Optional, First Generation) Pricing plan for this instance, can be one of PER_USE or PACKAGE.

properties.name: replication_type
properties.description: • replication_type - (Optional) Replication type for this instance, can be one of ASYNCHRONOUS or SYNCHRONOUS.

properties.name: user_labels
properties.description: • user_labels - (Optional) A set of key/value user label pairs to assign to the instance.
The optional settings.database_flags sublist supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the flag.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Optional) Value of the flag.
The optional settings.backup_configuration subblock supports:

properties.name: binary_log_enabled
properties.description: • binary_log_enabled - (Optional) True if binary logging is enabled. If settings.backup_configuration.enabled is false, this must be as well. Cannot be used with Postgres.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) True if backup configuration is enabled.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: • start_time - (Optional) HH:MM format time indicating when backup configuration starts.
The optional settings.ip_configuration subblock supports:

properties.name: ipv4_enabled
properties.description: • ipv4_enabled - (Optional) Whether this Cloud SQL instance should be assigned a public IPV4 address. Either ipv4_enabled must be enabled or a private_network must be configured.

properties.name: private_network
properties.description: • private_network - (Optional) The VPC network from which the Cloud SQL instance is accessible for private IP. For example, projects/myProject/global/networks/default. Specifying a network enables private IP. Either ipv4_enabled must be enabled or a private_network must be configured. This setting can be updated, but it cannot be removed after it is set.

properties.name: require_ssl
properties.description: • require_ssl - (Optional) True if mysqld should default to REQUIRE X509 for users connecting over IP.
The optional settings.ip_configuration.authorized_networks[] sublist supports:

properties.name: expiration_time
properties.description: • expiration_time - (Optional) The RFC 3339 formatted date time string indicating when this whitelist expires.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A name for this whitelist entry.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Optional) A CIDR notation IPv4 or IPv6 address that is allowed to access this instance. Must be set even if other two attributes are not for the whitelist to become active.
The optional settings.location_preference subblock supports:

properties.name: follow_gae_application
properties.description: • follow_gae_application - (Optional) A GAE application whose zone to remain in. Must be in the same region as this instance.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Optional) The preferred compute engine zone.

The optional settings.maintenance_window subblock for Second Generation instances declares a one-hour maintenance window when an Instance can automatically restart to apply updates. The maintenance window is specified in UTC time. It supports:

properties.name: day
properties.description: • day - (Optional) Day of week (1-7), starting on Monday

properties.name: hour
properties.description: • hour - (Optional) Hour of day (0-23), ignored if day not set

properties.name: update_track
properties.description: • update_track - (Optional) Receive updates earlier (canary) or later (stable)
The optional replica_configuration block must have master_instance_name set to work, cannot be updated, and supports:

properties.name: ca_certificate
properties.description: • ca_certificate - (Optional) PEM representation of the trusted CA's x509 certificate.

properties.name: client_certificate
properties.description: • client_certificate - (Optional) PEM representation of the slave's x509 certificate.

properties.name: client_key
properties.description: • client_key - (Optional) PEM representation of the slave's private key. The corresponding public key in encoded in the client_certificate.

properties.name: connect_retry_interval
properties.description: • connect_retry_interval - (Optional, Default: 60) The number of seconds between connect retries.

properties.name: dump_file_path
properties.description: • dump_file_path - (Optional) Path to a SQL file in GCS from which slave instances are created. Format is gs://bucket/filename.

properties.name: failover_target
properties.description: • failover_target - (Optional) Specifies if the replica is the failover target. If the field is set to true the replica will be designated as a failover replica. If the master instance fails, the replica instance will be promoted as the new master instance.

properties.name: master_heartbeat_period
properties.description: • master_heartbeat_period - (Optional) Time in ms between replication heartbeats.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) Password for the replication connection.

properties.name: sslCipher
properties.description: • sslCipher - (Optional) Permissible ciphers for use in SSL encryption.

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Optional) Username for replication connection.

properties.name: verify_server_certificate
properties.description: • verify_server_certificate - (Optional) True if the master's common name value is checked during the SSL handshake.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) The name of the Cloud SQL instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: common_name
properties.description: • common_name - (Required) The common name to be used in the certificate to identify the client. Constrained to [a-zA-Z.-_ ]+. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) The name of the Cloud SQL instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the user. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) The password for the user. Can be updated.
<hr/>

properties.name: host
properties.description: • host - (Optional) The host the user can connect from. This is only supported for MySQL instances. Don't set this field for PostgreSQL instances. Can be an IP address. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: billing_account
properties.description: • billing_account - (Required) The billing account to create the exclusion for.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the logging exclusion.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A human-readable description.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: • disabled - (Optional) Whether this exclusion rule should be disabled or not. This defaults to false.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: • filter - (Required) The filter to apply when excluding logs. Only log entries that match the filter are excluded. See Advanced Log Filters for information on how to write a filter.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the logging sink.

properties.name: billing_account
properties.description: • billing_account - (Required) The billing account exported to the sink.

properties.name: destination
properties.description: • destination - (Required) The destination of the sink (or, in other words, where logs are written to). Can be a Cloud Storage bucket, a PubSub topic, or a BigQuery dataset. Examples: "storage.googleapis.com/[GCS_BUCKET]" "bigquery.googleapis.com/projects/[PROJECT_ID]/datasets/[DATASET]" "pubsub.googleapis.com/projects/[PROJECT_ID]/topics/[TOPIC_ID]" The writer associated with the sink must have access to write to the above resource.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: • filter - (Optional) The filter to apply when exporting logs. Only log entries that match the filter are exported. See Advanced Log Filters for information on how to write a filter.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder
properties.description: • folder - (Required) The folder to be exported to the sink. Note that either [FOLDER_ID] or "folders/[FOLDER_ID]" is accepted.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the logging exclusion.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A human-readable description.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: • disabled - (Optional) Whether this exclusion rule should be disabled or not. This defaults to false.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: • filter - (Required) The filter to apply when excluding logs. Only log entries that match the filter are excluded. See Advanced Log Filters for information on how to write a filter.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the logging sink.

properties.name: folder
properties.description: • folder - (Required) The folder to be exported to the sink. Note that either [FOLDER_ID] or "folders/[FOLDER_ID]" is accepted.

properties.name: destination
properties.description: • destination - (Required) The destination of the sink (or, in other words, where logs are written to). Can be a Cloud Storage bucket, a PubSub topic, or a BigQuery dataset. Examples: "storage.googleapis.com/[GCS_BUCKET]" "bigquery.googleapis.com/projects/[PROJECT_ID]/datasets/[DATASET]" "pubsub.googleapis.com/projects/[PROJECT_ID]/topics/[TOPIC_ID]" The writer associated with the sink must have access to write to the above resource.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: • filter - (Optional) The filter to apply when exporting logs. Only log entries that match the filter are exported. See Advanced Log Filters for information on how to write a filter.

properties.name: include_children
properties.description: • include_children - (Optional) Whether or not to include children folders in the sink export. If true, logs associated with child projects are also exported; otherwise only logs relating to the provided folder are included.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name

properties.name: org_id
properties.description: • org_id - (Required) The organization to create the exclusion in.

properties.name: description
